DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Growth Factor Finished Pharmaceutical Product Tissue Donor Prior Collection Administered Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the name of the hematopoietic growth factor, endogenous growth factors to promote the development of blood cells, as pharmaceutical products that have undergone all stages of production and testing, was administered to a tissue donor, someone who gives blood or tissue to be used in another person, administered prior to tissue collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Growth Factor Finished Pharmaceutical Product Tissue Donor Prior Collection Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of hematopoietic growth factor, endogenous growth factors to promote the development of blood cells, as pharmaceutical products that have undergone all stages of production and testing, being administered to a tissue donor, someone who gives blood or tissue to be used in another person, prior to tissue collection.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Growth Factor Finished Pharmaceutical Product
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Endogenous growth factors which promote the development of blood cells.:A pharmaceutical product that has undergone all stages of production and testing, including packaging in its final container and labelling.

Concepts.definition: Endogenous growth factors which promote the development of blood cells.
A pharmaceutical product that has undergone all stages of production and testing, including packaging in its final container and labelling.

Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of gathering something together.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: G-CSF. A colony-stimulating factor that stimulates the production of neutrophils (a type of white blood cell).  It is a cytokine that belongs to the family of drugs called hematopoietic (blood-forming) agents. Also called filgrastim.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant therapeutic agent which is chemically identical to or similar to the endogenous cytokine granulocyte colony-stimulating factor (G-CSF).  Secreted by monocytes, macrophages and neutrophils and other cells after activation, G-CSF stimulates the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic progenitor cells committed to the neutrophil/ granulocyte lineage. (NCI04)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor. A colony-stimulating factor that stimulates the production of white blood cells, especially granulocytes and macrophages, and cells (in the bone marrow) that are precursors of platelets. It is a cytokine that belongs to the family of drugs called hematopoietic (blood-forming) agents. Also called sargramostim.

Concepts.definition: A recombinant therapeutic agent which is chemically identical to or similar to the endogenous glycoprotein cytokine growth factor granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor (GM-CSF). Therapeutic GM-CSF induces the clonal expansion and differentiation of progenitor blood cells and stimulates the cytotoxicity of monocytes and neutrophils, thereby restoring immune function and host antitumor immune responses and stimulating engraftment of transplanted bone marrow tissue. (NCI04)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
